review: I mean... it's a CPK.  You pretty much know what you're getting into as far as food goes - tasty, maybe a bit over priced, but in general good quality and yummy. This location though - heaven forbid you try to go here during dinner time. I have never managed to eat here without having to wait, and it's not for lack of space.  There are always TONS of open tables.  All I can guess is that the management is too inept to schedule enough wait staff in the evening. Save yourself some frustration and don't bother trying to eat here unless it's during VERY off hours.

I mean... it's a CPK.  You pretty much know what you're getting into as far as food goes - tasty, maybe a bit over priced, but in general good quality and yummy. This location though - heaven forbid you try to go here during dinner time. Save yourself some frustration and don't bother trying to eat here unless it's during VERY off hours.

Overall, it's ok, and I will likely continue to eat here a couple of times a year. I struggled when I had to decide what star rating to give CPK (I would really want to give them a 3.5), as I have had really good and less than ideal experiences. I went yesterday with a friend, and did not have a great time.  I ordered the focaccia bread as an appetizer. Honestly, it tasted ok, but it was just warm, not hot. I liked the flavor, and I will always eat as much fresh bread as I can, though it did strike me as odd that they charge for bread here.  I had a hard time deciding what I wanted for my main course, but I chose the Garlic Cream Fettuccine and paid the $3 to add chicken. This is where things got weird. My pasta came with about 4 bites of chicken on it, and there was barely any sauce (not even all of my noodles had sauce on them). When the waitress came to check on me, I let her know that there was not nearly enough chicken or sauce. She apologized then brought me a bowl of sauce with more chicken in it. I am sure it was just a rare mistake from the kitchen, and after adding the chicken and sauce to my plate, I felt much better, and really enjoyed the rest my dinner.  My waitress let the manager know about my complaint, so she came over to talk to me. She explained that they only add 2.5oz of chicken when they add chicken to the pasta, and their dishes do not have a lot of sauce on them. I explained that I understood that they do not put a lot of chicken, but what I was initially served was not nearly worth the $3 I was paying to have it added to my dinner. She then gave me a card worth a free small plate when I go in again. On a side note, I used to work for Big Buddy here in town, and CPK hosted a tour for the Little Buddies and even fed them lunch, so I definitely want to recognize them for that.

Chain restaurants are not usually how I roll, but every once in a while, I do help myself to CPK's Avocado Club Egg Rolls. Not many places in Baton Rouge serve foods containing avocados (shame, shame), so this is usually a nice treat for me.  The other menu items are okay too, though nothing is mind-blowing. CPK is good for large groups who have different tastes or picky eaters, you should be able to find something for everyone.

This California Pizza Kitchen is located within the Perkins Rowe area, a decent looking faux Downtown area. We originally came for the live music next door and for a place to sit down for drinks before heading off to dinner at Texas de Brazil. The service was a little slow, however the patio was nice and the service was OK.

This California Pizza Kitchen is located within the Perkins Rowe area, a decent looking faux Downtown area. We originally came for the live music next door and for a place to sit down for drinks before heading off to dinner at Texas de Brazil. The service was a little slow, however the patio was nice and the service was OK.
Fun & friendly staff, great food, awesome patio seating- what more could you ask for?
Fun & friendly staff, great food, awesome patio seating- what more could you ask for?

I went here on Thanksgiving Eve and it was a madhouse! The guy at the front desk had at least 15 to 20 people sitting in the lobby waiting for a table and he had absolutely NO "list" going. You could see that he was getting flustered so he just start rattling off table numbers to the other hostess to get everyone seated. After being seated, we had THE most wonderful waitress. I can not remember her name (maybe Rose?) but she was absolutely heavenly. She knew every aspect of the menu and had great recommendations. The reason I'm giving it a  3 is because it's a standard California pizza kitchen. Nothing fancy. I would go here in a pinch but it wouldn't make it more normal hangout spot because it is swarming with families with little kids. If you're looking for a piece of quiet or romance, this is not the place.

The food is good, don't try to do curbside service. They never come out and to your car. Once I went inside I was told someone would be right out. Now 15 minutes after my pickup time and still nothing.

I have tried this place 3 times since opening and one thing is always the same: HORRIBLE SERVICE.  I have literally been left waiting to find out who my server is for 15 minutes.  Last time our food took ages to come and our server had so many tables she couldn't refill drinks (not her fault).  The food is only OK so definitely not worth the trouble.  Too bad Perkins Rowe doesnt have better dining options in this price range.

CPK in Perkins Rowe is an easy dinner spot for the hubs and I.  It's close to the house and I love the upscale feel of Perkins Rowe.  We ate here on Friday night after coming up blank for at-home dinner ideas, and the wait was 15-20 when we got there.  We got a drink at the bar and waited... and waited... and waited.... luckily we didn't have a movie to catch, because 45 minutes later when I went to check on our time frame, I didn't see my husbands name or our pager # written down anywhere!!! Despite that, we were sat outside and our waiter (Casey) MORE than made up for the delay.  We had gotten a glass of J. Lohr Cab and a long island iced tea that made it through the whole meal.  We started with the arugula & asparagus salad and the wedge salad, which are always good choices (and labeled Gluten Free!) and my husband got the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza, while I got a gluten free pepperoni. We love sitting outside for the people-watching capabilities and weather.  I love that they are so dedicated to keeping their gluten free customers.  Make sure that if you're not celiac/intolerant, you tell them, because otherwise they will do the whole fastidious "glove change, counter cleaning, designated gf cooking area, only a mgr can bring out your food" thing, which I wouldn't wish on someone on a busy night if it wasn't absolutely necessary!   Prices are reasonable and service is good, I would recommend for a casual date night or group get together!

I'll give this place a "4" cause I really enjoyed the pizza I ordered.... stopped in about 2 weeks ago when we were in the midst of the ICE-pacolypse of 2014... weather had forced me and the boy into Perkins Rowe to catch a movie... Post movie looking for some grub and the choices were limited cause I had a teenage boy in tow... it came down to Voodoo BBQ or the CPK... didn't feel like BBQ and the CPK looked warm and inviting so we rolled over and immediately got a 2 top... even with the sketchy weather the place was packed... atmosphere was nice and inviting.... staff from hostess to waitstaff were all personable, friendly and efficient... The boy was digging it cause the scenery was littered with plenty of eye candy in his age range to scope out...I decided to go with pizza since that word is in the name....I ordered up the Sicilian(?) and ate every damn bite.... Loved the crispiness of the thin crust, felt the toppings were sufficient and overall it was a damn tasty eat.... The boy stretched his palate and ordered up a pepperoni pizza, SHOCKING I know and enjoyed his meal as well... Looks like this would be a good date night locale that can give you an intimate feel and affords some privacy to carry on a conversation without worrying others nearby are tuning in.... All in all an enjoyable experience and I'll definitely hit this locale up again....

As a manager of a restaurant, service training is desperately needed. A smile goes a long way. In about an 1 and a half hours, our server said maybe 10 words the whole time. Not even a thank you when he dropped the check. When he did come by the table, it was literally in passing. We enjoyed the food and drinks but we would have preferred our server to be more personable. We seemed to be causing him an inconvenience.

Not even a thank you when he dropped the check. When he did come by the table, it was literally in passing. We enjoyed the food and drinks but we would have preferred our server to be more personable. We seemed to be causing him an inconvenience.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I avoided it for the longest and REALLY wish I hadn't.  They carry my favorite wine in the world and it's really hard to find so I was shocked when I saw it. I have called nearly every liquor store in BR and had no luck. Anyway it's Sonoma Cutrer Russian River Ranches and it's $35 a bottle. I had the ravioli dish and it was yummy. Husband had the Hawaiian pizza and enjoyed it as well. Will definitely be back.

It's decent. I always order the same things: The Spicy Chipotle Chicken pizza on gluten free dough and the guacamole dip.  Their "flavored" teas are NOT good. They are just syrup flavors and way too sweet.

Great food and pizzas.  We love sitting at the bar and the friendly service.  We eat here much to often.
Great food and pizzas.  We love sitting at the bar and the friendly service.  We eat here much to often.

Loved it!  As a California transplant it was great to see the restaurant.  The atmosphere is relaxed next to a beautiful courtyard and water fountain.  The service was excellent.  A very upscale and yet relaxed atmosphere.  We've gone twice and the bar is an excellent hangout.

Is this the best restaurant in town...no.  Is it a great chain restaurant with a nice patio...YES!  CPK also has some great healthy options if you're into that.  The chicken chimichurri is one of the best things (IMO) but the other healthy items are great too.  There is a quinoa arugla salad that is a great vegetarian option with delicious champagne vinigrette.  The shrimp fetticine is made healthy with zuchini noodles and a lighter sauce.  For those who just want to eat and forget the calories, there are some pretty good options also.  I love almost any pizza here on thin crust, but be warned this is not your standard pizza.  There are pizzas with lettuce, BBQ sauce and even salsa.  If you're up for a change in your pizza, this place is a great option and you can enjoy the weather outside on their wrap around patio.  I've always wondered why more BR restaurants don't have outdoor seating but CPK got this one right!

Husband had the Hawaiian pizza and enjoyed it as well. Will definitely be back.

Great food! Thai salad was awesome. Uhm is it possibly if I could swim in the spinach & artichoke dip?! It's that good!!! Drinks are pretty good too! Lettuce wrap was amazing! I would totally come here with some girlfriends and do drinks and appetizers. Pizza is ok. They use to have a taco pizza that I loved but it's not on the menu anymore. Last time I went I got BBQ chicken pizza which was good but not great. I hate to say this but I'd rather eat dominos pizza.. last time I went it was for my step brothers birthday. They were pretty busy, service wasn't great. But oh well. Nutrition information is online !!!!

The atmosphere is so/so. It was full with a lot of older people. I kind of felt like I was in a Picadilly. The food is actually pretty enjoyable and comes in huge portions. I like that they give you the option to order half sizes on the salads. My waiter forgot to add chicken to my salad. Whatever. He was very pushy in trying to get us to order an appetizer. Back off man!  The pizza is good and they give you an option to have the whole wheat crust (for a fee).  It's loud when you sit over by the kitchen as well. Every time I have been, I sit outside on the patio. It's much nicer out there although the service is slower. Also, the small plates are actually quite small. Shocker, but really very small. Not worth the money in my opinion. If you're into chain restaurants and decent priced meals, give them a try!

This particular location has been a fairly frequent stop for me, as I live across the intersection from Perkins Row. The environment here is not altogether uncomfortable and happens to be a good place to grab some food and sit on the patio during the more pleasant months here in south Louisiana.  I have to admit that they have struggled at times with consistency in their production and service as well. When dining in, the inconsistency isn't so much of a problem as I can easily deal with them by making the issue known; however, when picking up a call in order it is rather inconvenient to have to wait for them to fix an issue when expediency is required. I do enjoy their food though, and when done right their pizzas are rather delicious. Only things I would recommend would be more variety in the drink menu, both wine and beer and a little more attention to detail in their service.  My favs: The meat lovers, the wild mushroom, and the jerk

"It's just okay for me".  Everything here is very cookie cutter.  Unfortunately, nothing stands out.  Although, I did have some of their dessert recently and I was extremely pleased.  Each time I eat pizza from any California Pizza Kitchen, it doesn't settle well in my stomach, so it has pretty much been salad from here on out at CPK.  I love the open kitchen here and the size of the restaurant, which is perfect for large groups.  The drinks here are pricey and are not the best.  They really should stick with pizza and just take the mixed drinks off the menu.  As for the staff... during my few visits here, I was not at all impressed by the staff.  They just seemed so unhappy to be working there... not enthusiasm at all.  Where's the peppiness?  Take-out is available and even a parking space outside, if you are picking up food!  It is situated in the ever so popular Perkins Rowe area, so I see the popularity of it from shopping and movie-going customers.  As for me, I only come back when I am invited by a friend that really wants to come here.

Dropped in for a late night after movie snack at 9:40PM last night. I attempted to sit at the bar but I noticed the bartender had the cash drawer out on the counter. She never acknowledged me at all but a very friendly waiter came over and said go a head have a seat. Then she said to him, not to me, "I am closed". Hmm Ok then. So the friendly waiter smiled and said sorry about that and told me to sit at any of the available booths and he would be right with me. I was full of movie popcorn but wanted a little nosh to top off the evening. I decided to try a small plate. You know that little card tucked inside the big menu that gets overlooked most of the time. I was tempted to order the quesadilla but asked the waiter what he liked the best. Spinach and mushroom flatbread he said, and that is what I ordered. The flatbread sat in the window a bit too long for my liking but I was still hopeful it was going to be good. Sorry to say it was only passable because the spinach was way too wet! I told the waiter about it and he offered to make something else. I decided to pick off the spinach and enjoy the mushroom flatbread. This small plate lived up to its name as it was less than a slice of pizza in volume at a cost of almost 7 bucks. Small plate but big price. California Pizza Kitchen has disappointed me in the past but never to the point of saying they have bad food. Tonight was no exception, the food is underwhelming and overpriced but passable. The coolest thing is you can see them cook your food and watch it sit there after it is done, so close and yet so far away from your table.

I don't always love to review chain restaurants, but I'm definitely a fan of CPK. The service is always great, and I love the variety of vegetarian options on the menu. Lately I have been ordering the BBQ chicken salad without chicken and it is amazing- it has fresh lettuce, jicama, carrots, corn, and onion with crispy tortilla strips and a delicious dressing. All of the salads are fantastic (even without the meat!) and are quite unique (the Moroccan salad has sweet potato and dates, which I love). The tostada pizza and the pear and arugula pizzas are my favorite, and I'm so happy that the tricolore salad pizza is back for the summer. Overall, it's one of my top picks for lunch or dinner in Perkin's Rowe. I typically try to frequent non-chain restaurants, but when this is the best option in the area I'll definitely go!

Learn to make the avocado spring rolls at home and save yourself a trip. The subpar service is not worth your tip. I wouldn't usually write such a review, but after a few failed attempts, it deserves noting.

Learn to make the avocado spring rolls at home and save yourself a trip. The subpar service is not worth your tip. I wouldn't usually write such a review, but after a few failed attempts, it deserves noting.

Usually I would rate this place maybe one star higher, but the service is just not great. The Avocado Club Rolls are what keeps us going, but tonight my fiancé found a recipe that will allow us to make our own. I do enjoy the atmosphere of the restaurant and I enjoy the food. Is it worth putting up with the horrible service? No. Our waitress did not check on us, we had to wait for her to flag her down to ask for marinara, and each time she came to the table to bring our food she just dropped the food off and left, no "Is there anything I can get you?"  I usually wouldn't allow one bad experience to influence my reviews, but it seems to be a pattern.  The place is huge. Offers a lot of seating and has a bar to sit at also. They offer a wide variety of dinner options, pizza, pasta, salads, etc.  If anything, I would recommend just ordering take out where you can park right next to the building and not deal with the crappy service!

Their Pizzas are good for one, interesting but limited variety... They do have some or the other appetizers. The one I had was a kind of a flat bread. It was not great.

Not a bad deal! Average food but clean establishment. I had the chili relleno and it was good. Nothing spectacular about the food presentation or taste, but the service was great and the food was hot. They have a nice outside patio with a nice view and water fountain. Polite staff and fast service. Great job!

20 mins after my pickup time and still waiting... The food is always good but the serves was too slow.
My new favorite is the California Veggie pizza - but I recommend adding Goat Cheese and Applewood Smoked Bacon!!
My new favorite is the California Veggie pizza - but I recommend adding Goat Cheese and Applewood Smoked Bacon!!

Like a lot of chains that have grown to feed the general population the food is just average.  It is predicable. I do go here when I want a pizza that is not plane Jane or some non traditional pasta.  This visit was not different.  We stated with a small plate, Arugula salad.  It was larger than expected and well dressed.  We followed it up with  a White pizza and asparagus pasta.  Both bf and I opted for the whole wheat substitute at no extra charge.  The pizza was bland, but the crust was very good.  The pasta was very Tastey.  Lots of spinach and asparagus in a light olive oil garlic sauce. A little heavy on the garlic, even for a stinking rose fan like me.  Service was good and food came out hot and well plated.   We will go back and give a few other menu items a try.

The atmosphere is so/so. It was full with a lot of older people. I kind of felt like I was in a Picadilly. The food is actually pretty enjoyable and comes in huge portions. I like that they give you the option to order half sizes on the salads. My waiter forgot to add chicken to my salad. Whatever. He was very pushy in trying to get us to order an appetizer. Back off man!  The pizza is good and they give you an option to have the whole wheat crust (for a fee).  It's loud when you sit over by the kitchen as well. Every time I have been, I sit outside on the patio. It's much nicer out there although the service is slower. Also, the small plates are actually quite small. Shocker, but really very small. Not worth the money in my opinion. If you're into chain restaurants and decent priced meals, give them a try!

This particular location has been a fairly frequent stop for me, as I live across the intersection from Perkins Row. The environment here is not altogether uncomfortable and happens to be a good place to grab some food and sit on the patio during the more pleasant months here in south Louisiana.  I have to admit that they have struggled at times with consistency in their production and service as well. When dining in, the inconsistency isn't so much of a problem as I can easily deal with them by making the issue known; however, when picking up a call in order it is rather inconvenient to have to wait for them to fix an issue when expediency is required. I do enjoy their food though, and when done right their pizzas are rather delicious. Only things I would recommend would be more variety in the drink menu, both wine and beer and a little more attention to detail in their service.  My favs: The meat lovers, the wild mushroom, and the jerk
20 mins after my pickup time and still waiting... The food is always good but the serves was too slow.
Great franchise. Staff ok. Food pretty good. No offering of bread though. No Tabasco.  Great outside deck and ambience. Had staple favorites- chicken fettuccine Alfredo
Great franchise. Staff ok. Food pretty good. No offering of bread though. No Tabasco.  Great outside deck and ambience. Had staple favorites- chicken fettuccine Alfredo

We have officially stopped coming here because of food and service. No matter what our server is always slow, has an attitude, AND messes up our order. We don't like their pizza, we don't like their pastas. The only thing we do like and do I mean LOVE is their quinoa and arugula salad. It is absolutely to die for and try as I might I can never get mine to taste nearly as delicious as theirs.

The price is a little much for the portion size but the food is good. Very tasty. The waiter confused us about the size by demonstrating with his hands we assumed the portions were much larger. The food was still good though and the place was very clean and nice inside.

Every time I go here I order the same thing but I forget what it's called. It's this salad topped with chicken breast that is covered in pesto cheese, tomatoes and more. It's absolutely delicious. The service is good, I have no complaints in that area. Overall good eat.

Every time I go here I order the same thing but I forget what it's called. It's this salad topped with chicken breast that is covered in pesto cheese, tomatoes and more. It's absolutely delicious. The service is good, I have no complaints in that area. Overall good eat.

We have officially stopped coming here because of food and service. No matter what our server is always slow, has an attitude, AND messes up our order. We don't like their pizza, we don't like their pastas. The only thing we do like and do I mean LOVE is their quinoa and arugula salad. It is absolutely to die for and try as I might I can never get mine to taste nearly as delicious as theirs.
The pizza was awesome .....dirty silverware and some kind of bad smell  otherwise nice

My daughter, the pizza-lover, always picks CPK, which I don't mind much, but this last time was pretty bad. The service had already been hit or miss the last few times we have gone, but that wasn't even the issue this time.  They seemed swamped, which couldn't be helped, but our poor little server was clearly given too many tables. He was very friendly and attentive, but it took a while for us to even order, which was rough with two hungry kids at 2 PM. The "best thing" on our table ended up being my kids' chicken nuggets. Pizza was mediocre, no Parmesan or red pepper shakers on the table, and received freezing cold packets of cheese after asking for some. But, here's the kicker...our appetizer chicken dumplings were seriously undercooked...as in, so pink they were almost red. I immediately realized it and almost gagged, but my poor husband had already inhaled three before we realized it. No flavor and almost raw. Yikes.

The food is pretty good depending on what you get. I got the Hawaiian BBQ pizza. It had fresh cut pineapple which I appreciated. My girlfriend got the garlic creme fettuccine with shrimp. She was unsatisfied with it. It wasn't very hot and the shrimp had the tails on it which made it hard to eat. Our waitress and hostess where very nice though

The food is pretty good depending on what you get. I got the Hawaiian BBQ pizza. It had fresh cut pineapple which I appreciated. My girlfriend got the garlic creme fettuccine with shrimp. She was unsatisfied with it. It wasn't very hot and the shrimp had the tails on it which made it hard to eat. Our waitress and hostess where very nice though

THINGS TO TRY:  1.) Smashed pea and barley soup 2.) California cobb salad 3.) Sangria Flat 4.) Red Wine Flat 5.) Salted caramel pudding 6.) Potato soup This is a chain so quality control helps with consistency. It is a great place to get moderately priced, good food. I listed things that weren't the pizza above, because the pizza is something you'll either love or hate. People are picky about their crust. I happen to like it when it is flatter, and this one has a thicker crust. It is still good, though.

I've been here a countless number of times and have never had such horrible service. Our server, Corey, took over five minutes to even get to our table to take our DRINK order. It is a Monday night. It's so slow that there should be absolutely no reason at all that the service should be this bad. He finally brought out my mom's drink and forgot my water.... How? I try to give other servers here a chance, but I'm done with CPK for a while. When the service is lacking, that means the management is lacking as well. CPK has a lot of improving to do for a corporate restaurant. Anyway, if anyone is looking for good service here, request JUNE! I only remember him because he's the best server there. So respectable and sophisticated.

After the waitress served us a cheese pizza as a margherita pizza, we asked where the toppings were and she replied, "Tomatoes don't come on it," when after checking the menu, it did. She then threw basil on our table for us to put on our own pizza. Manager never once apologized after complaining, and only reluctantly removed the pizza from the bill. No server should ever act this way! Awful service

Pizza is good but last time, I got the fish tacos. Really fresh and flaky. I was pleasantly surprised.
Pizza is good but last time, I got the fish tacos. Really fresh and flaky. I was pleasantly surprised.
The pizza was awesome .....dirty silverware and some kind of bad smell  otherwise nice

Very good place to eat in Perkins Rowe. I really like this whole area. After spending some time walking around and enjoying the shopping we decided to eat here for lunch.  The place was crowded and had a fast turn around time on the wait. That was nice since we had hungry kids with us.  The waiter was fast and attentive. The place was clean and had a cool ambiance to it with the low lighting. The kids went with their favorite.... Pizza, of coarse. The pizza was very good and it was enough for them to eat. I got the Mahi Mahi tacos. Wow. They were so good.  Lots of fresh ingredient and flavors that it was like something new every bite.  Really enjoyed this place and the food was excellent. Definitely coming back !

Thursday night... Not many people in the restaurant. Service was very slow. I noticed that she spent a lot of time at the table of "her own kind". If you know what I mean. This is not the first time this has happened. It took approximately 30 after eating to get the bill. Rediculous!! Other than that food was great! But over priced!

Thursday night... Not many people in the restaurant. Service was very slow. I noticed that she spent a lot of time at the table of "her own kind". If you know what I mean. This is not the first time this has happened. It took approximately 30 after eating to get the bill. Rediculous!! Other than that food was great! But over priced!

So quite frankly....I LOVE CPK. I have to admit I'm somewhat biased as I'm from CALIFORNIA but hey, it's good ok?! So let's start off with my faves. The Jamaican jerk pizza is like a party in your mouth. It's traditionally served on thin crust but I always ask for their traditional crust on mine. It's topped with chicken and bacon and peppers, oh my. And the jerk sauce really sets it off. It's honestly something I never would have expected from CPK and that makes it even more of a prize in my eye.  Pasta. They have this lemon asparagus spinach dish that I absolutely love. I love it so much, I've adopted it into my own homemade repertoire. You can add meat to this dish if you'd like, but I find it so light and refreshing, I'm like, what for? I have to be straight with you. My favorite salad is a SEASONAL one. *sad face*. It's the summer salad with pistachios watermelon strawberries and champagne dressing. My mouth is watering right now. No lie.  Dessert. Two words. Butter cake. As I live and breathe.  Treat yourself.  The Perkins Rowe location is always busy. And we've always received great service. The manager even comes by to check on us pretty regularly. Haven't had a bad visit yet, and we've gone quite frequently.

Stopped in for a quick bite before the movies. Service was fast and friendly and they got us fed and out in time for our show.  Pizza. We ordered the Sicilian pizza featuring Italian sausage, ham, salami, spicy capiciola (never can spell that right!)  and basil as toppings. It was a crispy thin crust and was well cooked.  Atmosphere was busy, a little crowded and noisy at times with large groups of youngsters dining nearby. But overall our visit was marked by good service and food for a fast meal.

Our waiter, Trevor, was really really rude and ignorant. We asked for a dessert menu 3 times and on the second time he flipped the check closed and was really rude about it. When he finally gave us the menu he was arrogant and frustrated about us asking. The food was delicious, but Trevor's service made the experience not one I'd wanna have again.

Our waiter, Trevor, was really really rude and ignorant. We asked for a dessert menu 3 times and on the second time he flipped the check closed and was really rude about it. When he finally gave us the menu he was arrogant and frustrated about us asking. The food was delicious, but Trevor's service made the experience not one I'd wanna have again.

***UPDATE*** I spoke with the GM about the situation and he definitely made it right. I will be returning to CPK because of my discussion with him. I will leave the review below, however, in case someone has a similar issue. ************** I was appalled by the service I received yesterday when I attended CKP. I started by ordering my food to go as I had a long day at work. Let me start off by saying I live in Perkins Rowe so it's easy for me to walk back to my apt. My wife called and stated she wanted to eat there since a band was playing in the courtyard. As I arrived I notified the hostess that I ordered my food to go, however, we changed our minds and would like to eat it in the patio. She then stated "unfortunately if you order your food to you cannot eat here you must take it to go" I was confused so I said "ok, I'll take my food then I would like to be seated for 2." Once again she stated very rude this time "no sir you will not, if you order to go food you aren't allowed to be seated"  she then motions her manager to front and while we wait for him to arrive I let her know I disagree and believe that's horrible service. This next part amazed me, she claimed its because "servers make tips and if you already have your food you won't tip the server". So by this time the manager arrived and the hostess says "can you explain to him he can't eat his to go order here" the manager now "sir you aren't allowed to order to go food and then eat it in the restaurant" I then mentioned "I understand what you are saying but I originally ordered to go but changed my mind and decided to want to eat here and I can't do that" his response "NO"... I requested my order to be cancelled and then he stated "I guess I can ALLOW it this one time" and when I say allow he really emphasized allow with eyes rolled head shake and attitude. By then I was very upset and cancelled my entire order and told him that's pretty "shitty service" and proceeded next door to eat at Lava Cantina and received amazing service.

Kevin was an amazing server. Whatever we wanted he made sure it happened. I ordered the avocado corn dip, split pea soup and half a salad. Food was good but the service was great!  It was a busy Saturday but I didn't rushed at all. The patio was totally worth waiting 10 minutes for.  Coming back!

Kevin was an amazing server. Whatever we wanted he made sure it happened. I ordered the avocado corn dip, split pea soup and half a salad. Food was good but the service was great!  It was a busy Saturday but I didn't rushed at all. The patio was totally worth waiting 10 minutes for.  Coming back!

The price is a little much for the portion size but the food is good. Very tasty. The waiter confused us about the size by demonstrating with his hands we assumed the portions were much larger. The food was still good though and the place was very clean and nice inside.

My boyfriend and I went to dine here and we showed up starving and ready to eat. The hostess was friendly and cleared off a booth for us.  Our server was very slow and we didn't even know her name until we got the check. She took five minutes to greet us and we were in need of refills with our sever no where in site. The food was good, but far overpriced for the size potion you get. I ordered the chicken Alfredo and it was delicious but the portion was not worth 14$. My boyfriend got the five cheese pizza and it was an extra $3 to add pepperoni. We both ate all of our food and we're still slightly hungry after. I like to get a bang for my buck and this was not it. They also do not offer a military discount of which I was highly disappointed.

I ordered a Cobb Salad for curbside pickup. When I got home I opened my salad and all it was, was lettuce, chicken and a few pieces of bacon with a bunch of beets tossed into a to go box. I ordered a salad with no beets... as I further investigated I realize that this is someones leftovers that they wanted to bring home after eating at the restaurant. The manager was nice when I called and is sending me a $15 gift card to cover the salad I purchased, but what makes you think I will return to an establishment that sells me a mostly eaten salad leftover from someone who was eating at the restaurant? Disgusting.

Came here for lunch on a Friday and with two coworkers. I had fairly low expectations for a healthy option but was still disappointed. I settled for a half salad and sandwich, hoping to get the most bang for the calories. While the food was fairly tasty, I was hungry two hours later.  Our waiter, Trevor, was easy on the eyes but was also slow and inattentive. I suspect most patrons forgive him for the latter because of the former. He never filled our drinks or checked on us during the meal. It took us over 20 minutes to get the check and a to-go dessert. While this may work for a lazy Sunday, it is totally unacceptable for the professional crowd.  This is the second time in a month that the service has disappointed. I would stay away from here unless you have an hour and a half at minimum.

I've been here several times, and could usually give it three stars, but I'll base this review on the experience had this time. We had a group of 5 on a not-too-busy Saturday night recently - the 45 minute wait was expected because it looked like they were short some staff. We were seated next to a family whose child obviously did not enjoy the chicken he had as he threw half of it on the ground, a nice surprise when you step on a piece. (After the family left, there was no attempt to clean it either.) Fueling for the marathon, i opted for the spaghetti bolognese. After putting in our order, the server returned as she knew she had forgotten at least one order - it was mine. So kudos to her for checking because other places in town have just let the oversight go. The glass of wine i ordered, as expected, cost $1 less than I could usually buy it at the store, but that's very much expected. The pasta was cooked slightly less than al dente, which was a bit surprising for the first bite. The sauce was really good, though. So there's that. The bathrooms could have used some attention, but in their defense, it was a Saturday evening. The server was sweet as could be overall. I mean, CPK is very much a chain, something i want to avoid, but we were going for easy and simple that night. I'm sure if i need a good break while shopping, I'll go back, but it won't be my first choice.

I like CPK in general.  This time we went with my brother and kids.  So this feedback is specific for going with larger groups. For larger parties this place is not great.   General feedback:  The front desk needs to be trained on how to better estimate wait time and talk to people.  Manager did very well, than the greeter.  It would have been a great experience if we dealt with just manager and servers. For larger parties with kids pick a place which has reservations.  Our large party was 11.

Awful service for an early dinner on a Friday night. How do you not have cold sparkling water? And then asked do you want it hot?  Cocktail served pretty much after dinner when ordered before dinner. Pizza, egg rolls, wedge salad were the food. Egg rolls largely wrapper. Salad ok but huge chunk of cold fatty bacon sitting on plate.  Too many squirmy kids at tables all around at 6 PM. Line out door when we left. Not the place for any semblance of a nice relaxed meal here. More like a cattle call and turn the table asap exercise.  I will skip it next time and stay at Bin 77 Sidebar for a burger.
The food was good. The best part was the dumplings on the appetizer list. The place was packed , but that didn't keep our food from being delivered in a timely manner.
The food was good. The best part was the dumplings on the appetizer list. The place was packed , but that didn't keep our food from being delivered in a timely manner.

First of all, it took an hour to get my Bloody Mary, which tasted horrible. By the time it came out we were finished eating. It wasn't spicy at all and was basically just tomato juice and vodka. No black pepper, Tabasco, lemon, lime spicy beans or Worcestershire. Can you even call that a bloody? The worst I've ever had. I didn't drink it. Our pasta was cold, unseasoned and bland. Service was just OK. Server never asked about how our food or drinks tasted, or if we needed anything else after we got our food originally. Overall just lousy and not very friendly or attentive. Granted it was a relatively busy Thursday night, but you would think they would be prepared for this, considering almost every Thursday night it gets busy due to the weekly live music in Perkins Rowe on Thursdays. Probably won't ever come back. Only giving 2 stars because it is relatively inexpensive for the portions, and I've had a decently-tasting pizza here before. I wouldn't recommend to anyone.

First of all, it took an hour to get my Bloody Mary, which tasted horrible. By the time it came out we were finished eating. It wasn't spicy at all and was basically just tomato juice and vodka. No black pepper, Tabasco, lemon, lime spicy beans or Worcestershire. Can you even call that a bloody? The worst I've ever had. I didn't drink it. Our pasta was cold, unseasoned and bland. Service was just OK. Server never asked about how our food or drinks tasted, or if we needed anything else after we got our food originally. Overall just lousy and not very friendly or attentive. Granted it was a relatively busy Thursday night, but you would think they would be prepared for this, considering almost every Thursday night it gets busy due to the weekly live music in Perkins Rowe on Thursdays. Probably won't ever come back. Only giving 2 stars because it is relatively inexpensive for the portions, and I've had a decently-tasting pizza here before. I wouldn't recommend to anyone.

Should be renamed Americas Skimpiest Pizzas.  Went here for lunch yesterday and ordered a Hawaiian Pizza for my wife, son and myself. Their pizzas are about 13" and was sliced into six slices. The amount of cheese and toppings was pathetic! It looked like they used -maybe- two slices of ham lunch meat and a single pineapple ring and just sliced them up to spread them around. Very little cheese and sauce. Never Again! The service was slow and not the person that seared us certainly gave the impression that we were imposing by wanting to eat lunch.

Awful service for an early dinner on a Friday night. How do you not have cold sparkling water? And then asked do you want it hot?  Cocktail served pretty much after dinner when ordered before dinner. Pizza, egg rolls, wedge salad were the food. Egg rolls largely wrapper. Salad ok but huge chunk of cold fatty bacon sitting on plate.  Too many squirmy kids at tables all around at 6 PM. Line out door when we left. Not the place for any semblance of a nice relaxed meal here. More like a cattle call and turn the table asap exercise.  I will skip it next time and stay at Bin 77 Sidebar for a burger.

My cousin and her family was seated before I arrived. After meeting them at the table we waited for a good 10 minutes of so before our server came to our table and advised us that he was a little behind. We brushed it off and figured we would have our drinks and food ordered at the same time. He came back in less than 10 minutes and took our order. After he left, another server stopped by and asked if we had been helped...or course us sitting there for the first 20 minutes didn't give anyone the indication that we weren't served yet...About another 10-15 minutes passed and we see him JUST putting our order in.  What should have taken an easy 15 minutes order to food to table process took 30-45 minutes. My poor nephew, his dad had to go to the restaurant next door to get him some French fries.  I ordered the chicken spaghettini (I believe that's what it's called) and the spicy fried cauliflower (forgot the exact menu listing). The cauliflower was delicious. Very unexpected. The spaghettini on the other hand, was very bland. I was expecting some sort of sauce, even a butter garlic sauce but nope. The noodles were cooked and just thrown in the plate and then the asparagus and spinach was thrown on top with the chicken. The veggies and chicken was seasoned a bit better. I think that if the asparagus and spinach was seasoned and tossed with the noodles, the dish may have been better.  I've been the CPK before and service was not this bad. I would hope that if the server is overwhelmed, they let the hostess know so they have a chance to catch up OR even give the table to another server so the customers get a better service. The server came up and mentioned to us not to let this one experience ruin CPK all entirely.  Oh! And then when the bill came the server charged us for an extra kids drink when one was supposed to be with the kids meal. So double check your bills.

A friend and I stopped here for dinner the other night and everything was surprisingly good. We were kinda hesitant eating here after seeing some really negative reviews, but are glad we went anyway. We were greeted and sat promptly. Our server greeted us within a few minutes too.  He was nice, attentive, and quick with drink refills/table clearing. Foodwise, we tried the: Avocado Ranch Egg Rolls - These were soo good. Imagine a mini club sandwich wrapped in a wonton then deep fried. Also, the ranch sauce did not taste like the bottled stuff in supermarkets.  BBQ Chicken Pizza with Pineapple - Yes, there were not a ton of meat and sauce on top, but the topping's flavors and texture of the crust were spot on. Would order this again in the future. Thai Pizza - Honestly, this was just ok... Growing up eating a lot of Thai food, I felt it really lacked something to call it "Thai."  Two managers(Dorothy and Ryan) also stopped by and made sure everything was fine. They were both really nice and knowledgeable about the menu. They recommended a Butter Cake dessert, but we were way too full. Overall, I think we would be back if we're in the area again.

This is the worst restaurant I have ever been too. I would rather go to little caesars and get a $5 dollar pizza there that would be a 100 times worth my money than the piece of dried pizza with a hole in it that I received. The last time I checked California pizza kitchen specializes in pizza right. It was terrible beyond terrible and would never set foot in that restaurant again. I didn't even want to give one star to rate the pizza here, but I had to give at least one star

We had good service here and the food tasted good. My only complaint was we ordered a Margherita pizza but they were so skimpy on the basil, I thought they got our order wrong and brought us cheese pizza

We had good service here and the food tasted good. My only complaint was we ordered a Margherita pizza but they were so skimpy on the basil, I thought they got our order wrong and brought us cheese pizza

I've been to this CPK location quite a few times- everytime leaving with a not so great experience, and I have got to say it does NOT get better. They have many pizza choices, all of which are pretty good! However the reason for giving a rating of 3 stars is due to the service!!! Being seated for more than 5 minutes, our server did not come to us to greet or take our drink order. Many of the staff seems very unenthusiastic about their jobs and you will openly see them on their phone and not doing anything! During our meal, our server did not come to check up on us and had us having our empty water cups just sitting there for a while.

So my coworkers and I went to CPK for lunch. Let's just say this is not a place to eat at if you have a designated lunch time. There was no one at the hostess stand when we entered but when they came, we were seated immediately. The waitress came and took drink orders.  When she came back she dropped the drinks off and left swiftly. Considering we were on lunch, we were ready to order. I made contact with her and she came to the table and said she had to bring another table their card back before she could take our order. On the way back she stopped at 2 other tables.  She came and we ordered our lunches. My coworker kindly said "we are in lunch" she replied "I understand but I'm busy too"  Someone else joined the party. She passed the table several times and never stopped by to offer the new person a drink or see if she wanted to eat. We literally had to wave our arms for her to stop.....literally  The food was just ok ........

I've been here to eat quite a few times. It's really nice when you go in the evening time and sit in the outside part. The square in Perkins rowe is all lighted up and beautiful with the fountain, so it makes for a great date night. The menu has a good selection of pizzas, pasta and flat breads. They have a really good potato soup as well. I love the garlic cream fettuccine alfredo. It's very creamy and good. As far as pizza goes, I usually get the meat cravers pizza. One pizza is plenty to split between two people.

Slow day today everyone in Baton Rouge at LSU game do I decided to stop by and get my veterans meal on lunch break. I was seated as soon as I walked up. Now it's been 10 min and I haven't had anyone come take my order. I don't know how to rate this. But I feel neglected because a party of four women walked in and they were served right away. I hope it's not because I am well darker complexion. Guess I am moving to the next restaurant. Won't be coming here again.
